reviews.text: I have stayed at the hotel twice in the past year. I have nothing to complain about, the things you would expect is there and the staff help you out with the rest. The only minor thing I could comment on is that the check-in and -out takes quite long.
reviews.title: Central location - helpful staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Bucharest, Romania for 1 night post cruise (Viking RIver). It was a very beautiful hotel within walking distance of many of the main attractions in Bucharest as well as convenience to the Old Town. The Old Town is just a 5-10 min walk to the hotel so it was a very nice evening to stroll down the pedestrian walkways. The Old Town is close to the University of Bucharist so there were many places to eat and have a bite or just have something light in the many cafes there. There were also many clubs there as well.
reviews.title: Lovely & City Centered Hotel in Bucharest, Romania

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet (which we had included from our river cruise) was the largest buffet with a large variety of foods to choose from. The hotel has a spa, swimming pool and has this amazing bar which simulates an ice bar with water flowing underneath the bar stools so you think you were on an iceberg.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in the Centre of Bucharest

reviews.text: Excellent in every way, rooms had all and more than we needed or wanted, service was superb and there was every facility that one could want. Food highly recommended. Hotel is also attractive. Would definitely use again.
reviews.title: First choice in Bucharest

reviews.text: Probably the best 5-stars Hotel in Bucharest: excellent rooms and service, glittering lounge bar and breathtaking outdoor swimming pool. Also Madonna stayed here in occasion of her concert in Bucharest a few years ago.
reviews.title: Excellent value even if there was a problem at the entrance

Nicest Radisson I've ever stayed in
reviews.text: The hotel is situated centrally in Bucharest and not too far away from the airport.

I was quite lucky as I found out my booked room was actually a Business-class room - no complaints from me there. This allowed me access to the Business lounge on the 9th floor where there's a bit of tranquility, snacks, food and beverages on offer throughout the day.
reviews.title: Εξαιρετικό - excellent choice

reviews.text: The room was very nice - must be the first time I've actually gone into a hotel room and enjoyed the smell that welcomed me in. The room itself was very well equipped with lovely bed which allowed me a wonderful and well-needed sleep. The bathroom and shower were also top-notch. There seems to be a nice bar downstairs but I arrived too late in the night to go down and have a dew drinks. The gym that is linked to the hotel is also 1st class - very well equipped, spacious and was well populated with what seemed like people walking off the set of Beverly Hills 90210 - all svelte, ripped and not a hair out of place.
reviews.title: this hotel have it all

reviews.text: Breakfast was offered in the Business lounge though had limited choice but sufficient for my tastes.
reviews.title: A good hotel with good fitness facilities

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2013.
reviews.title: Very good- beware of Travel Republic bookings!

reviews.text: Firstly and importantly, please be aware of what booking agent you use to make a reservation at this hotel. I did so using Travel Republic and without notice or warning, our reservation was made in " D Block" which is not part of the main hotel; whilst clean etc; it is old fashioned and an absolute nightmare to find as you have to pass at least two security doors.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!

reviews.text: So, we returned to reception and asked to change rooms. The agent did this however we had to pay an extra £60 a night to stay in the main part of the hotel; we had already paid £72 a night using Travel Republic. Therefore, this doesn't appear to be connected to the hotel itself but £132 a night for a room is a bit steep and I have taken up a complaint with Travel Republic as I believe their website is misleading and did not tell us that we would be staying in a side block, annex type room, away from the main hotel.
reviews.title: Nice but they need to do something about the AC

reviews.text: According to the Radisson agent, this has happened a few times before with customers and it doesn't seem to be very fair or transparent in their pricing.
reviews.title: Good place to stay when for business in Bucharest

reviews.text: it had a fully stocked mini bar, complementary coffee and tea making facilities, a small tv for the size of the room with a vast number of satelite channels plus some movie channels and movies on demand, radio stations, view bill etc.there were a trousers press and an iron.the room was nicely decorated.the bed was comfortable so were the pillows, duvets and good quality linens.there was a good working area with an office type leather armchair.the lightning of the room was good the bathroom was clean and nice.the shower wasn't particular powerfull and bathtub/shower were combined.bathroom cosmetics were fewer than it should be for two persons and even anne semonin not of very good quality.the lightning in the bathroom especially during shaving was not the best.there was a hairdryer that was almost powerless.the towels and bathrobes unfortunatelly were of rather cheap quality not the kind you expect in a 5 star hotel.there were slippers as well.
